workout_title: Beginner Biceps and Back Superset Workout

warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles, gradually increasing the size. Perform 2 sets of 30 seconds each direction.
Swing arms forward and backward, opening up the chest. Perform 2 sets of 15 swings.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching and rounding your back. Perform 2 sets of 10 reps.

exercises.setup: Use a preacher bench to angle your upper arm. Adjust the seat so your armpits are comfortably resting on the top of the pad.
execution: 1. Sit on the preacher bench with your arms resting on the pad and grab the bar with an underhand grip.
2. Start with your arms fully extended.
3. Curl the bar towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Use an incline bench set at a 45-degree angle. Sit back with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Sit on the incline bench with your back against the pad.
2. Hold the dumbbells with an underhand grip, arms fully extended.
3. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top.
5. Lower the weights back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on keeping your elbows stationary to maximize biceps engagement. Avoid swinging the weights.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
execution: 1. Grip the bar with a wide grip, palms facing forward.
2. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Use a lat pull-down machine with a neutral grip attachment. Sit down and adjust the knee pad.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grip the attachment with palms facing each other.
2. Pull the bar down to your upper chest, keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arms. Keep your chest up and core engaged.

exercises.setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward.
execution: 1. Stand facing away from the cable machine, holding the handles with an underhand grip.
2. Step forward to create tension in the cables.
3. Curl the handles towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary.
4. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Stand tall with your arms fully extended, holding the dumbbells.
2. Curl the weights up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top.
4. Lower the weights back to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 50-60% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Maintain a steady pace and avoid swinging the weights. Focus on the contraction of your biceps.

exercises.setup: Use a chest-supported row machine or incline bench.
execution: 1. Lie face down on the bench with your chest supported and feet firmly on the ground.
2. Grab the handles or bar with a neutral grip.
3. Pull the weight towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
5. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
exercises.weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit at a cable row machine with feet on the platform and knees slightly bent.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Grab the handle with both hands and sit upright.
2. Pull the handle towards your abdomen, keeping your back straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows you to complete 10 reps with good form, typically around 60-70% of your 1RM.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on squeezing your back muscles at the top of the movement. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability.
